[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: ANS supports ATM withdrawals  deposits  transfers  and balance inquiries with encryption.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: ANS manages ATM transactions  authentication  cash handling  and receipt generation.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: ANS integrates with bank servers  clearinghouses  and fraud monitoring systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 User Interfaces: ANS provides touchscreens for customers  terminals for bank staff with PIN authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: ANS supports card readers  cash dispensers  printers  and biometric authentication.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: ANS uses PostgreSQL storage  REST APIs for real-time banking integration.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.5 Communications Interfa: ANS ensures encrypted transactions via SSL/TLS.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: ANS ensures 24/7 uptime with scheduled maintenance.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: ANS integrates with fraud detection  audit systems.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 MISSING-TAG2: ANS optimizes storage for high-volume transactions.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: ANS is used by customers  bank staff managing transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: ANS requires stable network connectivity for real-time operations.
[SUBSEC] 1.8 Definitions: Cash Card: Card enabling ATM-based transactions.
Clearinghouse: Financial institution processing interbank transactions.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 Assumptions and Dependencie: ANS relies on bank servers  secure authentication  ATM hardware reliability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 MISSING-TAG1: The ATM Network System (ANS) defines secure  real-time transaction processing across banks.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The ATM shall authenticate users via PIN  card validation  incorporating fraud monitoring (REQ-INTF-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall process withdrawals  deposits  transfers  balance inquiries (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall print receipts  display transaction summaries (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall log transactions with fraud detection markers for security audits (REQ-DB-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with bank servers to authenticate users  process transactions (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall securely connect with transaction clearinghouses for interbank transfers (REQ-FUNC-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The ATM interface shall support multiple languages  accessibility options.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process transactions within 5 seconds under normal conditions.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall implement AES-256 encryption for data security.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 Standards Compliance.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall comply with PCI-DSS  ISO/IEC 27001 security standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall log all ATM transactions with role-based access control.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-DB-001: The system shall securely store transaction logs  authentication data  account balances.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Tests transaction processing  authentication validation  fraud detection  compliance enforcement.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Operational manuals  API integration guides  security compliance policies  incident response protocols.
[SEC] 5. References: PCI-DSS  ISO 27001  banking network regulations  fraud prevention frameworks.
